reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: FLC: Action for Basic Development Initiatives

description.narrative: - Organize and strengthen about 20 women groups that comprises about 400 women/institutions (10groups in each kebele) organize different awareness raising workshops in the area of child and women trafficking for government stakeholders and public at large . Render trainings for 100 women on child and women trafficking communication leadership + business: disburse working capital. Provision of school support for children that return home.- This will be done to improve the wellbeing of children and women by c urbing trafficking reducing the risk of women will enable to enhance the socio-economic competence of women.-Strengthened and vibrant women institutions will be established legislative and administrative measures will be enacted against child and women tra ffickers. Rented children will be reunified with their families and be enrolled to school. Risky traditional practices on girls/women and children be reduced and the school drop out of children mainly girls will be reduced. Access to financial services wil l be availed for poor and needy women.-Direct beneficiaries are 400 women and 100 children; while 3000 community members will benefit indirectly from the project.-Co actors will be woreda bureau of justice women+ children affairs office bureau of social an d labor affairs. Action for Basic Development Initiatives will be the implementer. The NGO was selected from the applicants on the call for proposal made in the Embassy web site for 2016 funding. No web site of the NGO.

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is a secondary priority area in this activity
Strengthening of the rights and status of women and girls is the main priority area in this activ ity
